isis.stitle: BP-R1 BOBTAIL BRAKE PROPORTIONING RELAY VALVE AND LQ-5 BOBTAIL LIMITING VALVE - DISASSEMBLE - LQ-5 BOBTAIL LIMITING VALVE

svcproc.title: LQ-5 BOBTAIL LIMITING VALVE
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 16 for all items in parentheses.

caution.para: The LQ-5 may be lightly clamped in a bench vise during disassembly, however, over-clamping will cause damage to the valve and result in leakage and/or malfunction.

svcproc.para: If a vice is used, clamp around the supply port and the mounting surface.

step1.para: Remove all air fittings and plugs from valve.
Before removing the four Phillips head screws that secure the cover to the body, mark the relationship between cover and body.
Remove and retain the four screws (Item 8) and the metal tag (Item 7) with the LQ-5 piece number on it. Separate the cover (Item 9) from body (Item 13). Remove and discard O-ring (Item 1).
Remove the blend back piston (Item 14) and the proportioning piston (Item 12) from the body (Item 13).
Separate and retain the pistons. Remove and retain the spring seat (Item 11) from the proportioning piston (Item 12).

With a pair of needle nose pliers, grasp the end of the valve spring (Item 6) inside the proportioning piston (Item 12). Remove the spring by pulling and turning clockwise. Discard the spring (Item 6).
Remove and discard inlet/exhaust valve (Item 5) from the proportioning piston (Item 12).
Remove and discard O-rings (Items 2, 3 and 4) from the pistons.
